feels.name: Confusion
feels.quote: She was sure that she ought not to be with these men; but they had cast a spell over her.

causedBy.name: Being in the presence of the Emersons

feels.name: Pity
feels.quote: She was no theologian, but she felt that here was a very foolish old man, as well as a very irreligious one.

causedBy.name: Mr. Emerson's comments on his son

feels.name: Amusement
feels.quote: Surely one ought to laugh. A young man melancholy because the universe wouldnâ€™t fit, because life was a tangle or a wind, or a Yes, or something!

feels.name: Maternal Concern
feels.quote: The dear George, now striding towards them over the tombstones, seemed both pitiable and absurd.
